title: Brendan Rodgers responds after Jurgen Klopp slams Leicester star over Mohamed Salah tackle
text:
Brendan Rodgers has responded to Jurgen Klopp’s criticism of the Leicester star (Picture: Getty)

Brendan Rodgers has defended Hamza Choudhury after Jurgen Klopp blasted the Leicester star following Liverpool’s dramatic Premier League win at Anfield.

The Reds maintained their perfect start to the season on Saturday with a 2-1 victory but Klopp was nevertheless furious after the match due to Choudhury’s challenge on Mohamed Salah.

Salah was forced off during stoppage time following a late tackle from Choudhury and a fuming Klopp said the Leicester midfielder needed to ‘calm down’.

Asked about Klopp’s comments, Foxes boss Rodgers said: ‘I don’t think it was an overly bad challenge.

Klopp was furious with Hamza Choudhury after he injured Mohamed Salah (Picture: Getty)

‘Mo Salah is coming inside at speed and there’s a clash of course. With the emotion of the game at that time, it might seem worse than it was.

‘He [Choudhury] was just trying to get back into position. Mo cut across him and there’s a collision. He’s an honest boy.

‘He makes challenges, he’s aggressive but I don’t think there was anything malicious in it at all.’

Liverpool appeared to be set to drop points for the first time in the Premier League this season when James Maddison cancelled out Sadio Mane’s first-half opener at Anfield.

But Mane won a stoppage-time penalty and James Milner held his nerve to convert from the spot as Champions League holders Liverpool clinched another win.

Klopp said after the match: ‘It was a super game. We upped the tempo. The football we played was so important. Leicester’s goal really stopped us but then we wanted to go forwards.

‘The penalty was obviously a penalty. We knew it would probably happen, we knew we were going to fight for the win – and we did.

‘Without luck, we cannot win the amount of games we have won, but over the 90 minutes we deserved it – we deserved the three points.’
